media:group.media:title: DevFest Europe Keynote 2022
media:group.media:description:
We are excited to welcome people in-person and online for DevFest 2022! Hear about the impactful projects people are working on at various GDG chapters in Europe. Learn about the technologies and motives behind these projects with plans to help restore environmental degradation, create clean energy from hydrogen, and more! Discover how developers use Google technologies to create innovative solutions together.
Learn more about Google Developer Groups → https://goo.gle/3laRM8p Find a Google Developer Group hosting a DevFest near you → https://goo.gle/3Tty2fX Follow our European ​Twitter channel to hear more from our communities, programs, and events! → https://goo.gle/GoogleDevEurope-Twitter
Chapters: 0:00 - Show opener 0:29 - Welcome from Florina Muntenescu, Android Developer Relations Engineer at Google 3:24 - Community Highlights with Alessandro Palmieri, Google Developers Groups Program Lead in Europe 3:58 - GDG Lleida, Dronecoria 4:17 - GDG Athens 4:35 - GDG Burgos 4:59 - GDG Lisbon 5:15 - Solution Challenge projects from Europe 6:00 - Hearts with Ukraine 6:57 - Closing remarks
Speakers: Florina Muntenescu - Android Developer Relations Engineer at Google Alessandro Palmieri - Google Developers Groups Program Lead in Europe
Subscribe to Google Developer Groups → https://goo.gle/GDevGroups
#DevFest

media:group.media:title: AMA: Web @ DevFest Panel
media:group.media:description: Web @ DevFest - a Global Meetup for Web Developers - powered by Google Chrome and DevFest 2021, is an exclusive online event designed to bring web enthusiasts closer together. Get ready for an Ask Me Anything panel with questions from the audience, various networking opportunities and bonuses!

media:group.media:title: DevFest: Learning together
media:group.media:description:
DevFest provides an opportunity for local developers to learn, connect as a community, and explore Google technology to accelerate economic impact. It’s a community-led tech conference tailored to uniquely fit local dev ecosystems and come together to solve problems and address real needs.
Find a DevFest near you → https://goo.gle/DevFest2021
Subscribe to Google Developer Groups → https://goo.gle/GDevGroups
event: DevFest 2021;

entry.title: Christopher Patnoe - Closing Keynote: Building Inclusively, Building Accessible

media:group.media:title: Christopher Patnoe - Closing Keynote: Building Inclusively, Building Accessible
media:group.media:description:
Christopher will discuss three principles about building inclusively and will share examples from Google demonstrating them. *This session will be supported by a sign interpreter
Bio Christopher Patnoe is the Head of Accessibility and Disability Inclusion for EMEA at Google. He leads Google's efforts around the accessibility of products, people (both Googler and end users) and partnerships. He has more than 25 years experience in Tech working at companies like Apple, Sony Ericsson and Disney where he's built hardware, software, and services. His current passion is Accessibility at the intersection of immersive technologies (AR/VR) and consumer hardware. He is the chair for the Immersive Captions Community Group with the W3C, is a co-Chair of the XR Association Accessibility Working Group, and sits on the Board of Trustees for the American Foundation for the Blind and for the GAAD Foundation. Christopher has a degree in Music from UC Berkeley.
https://twitter.com/cdpatnoe
This talk is part of our DevFest Inspire event! #DevFestInspire
DevFest Inspire is a virtual event celebrating the end of the DevFest 2021 season where we’ll recognize content created by the community, as well as Googlers from Europe and Africa.
You can also network and connect with other developers during the event! → Learn more and sign up at https://goo.gle/devfest-inspire ! → Check more events and content: https://gdg.community.dev/events/#/list
Links to the videos in the presentation: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uwOike_GVJA https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jLCwjIaPXwA

media:group.media:title: Self-Driving Cloud: Autoscaling & Recommendations
media:group.media:description:
Filip is a senior Software Engineer in Google Cloud in Warsaw, Poland. He will present the challenges of running a reliable, scalable and easy to manage service in Cloud and how GCP's autoscaling and workload management products can help.

entry.title: Luke Barrington‎ - Simulation City: Transforming Real-World Data Into A 3D Digital Twin Of The Earth

media:group.media:title: Luke Barrington‎ - Simulation City: Transforming Real-World Data Into A 3D Digital Twin Of The Earth
media:group.media:description:
For simulation to be valuable as a learning tool, it has to closely match our target domain – performing rider-only trips for Waymo One and goods delivery trips for Waymo Via in the real world– in which case, there is only one question that matters. Did the Waymo Driver safely and efficiently complete the trip?
To answer this question, Waymo created a software solution internally dubbed SimulationCity to add to our industry-leading evaluation tools. SimulationCity automatically synthesizes entire journeys to assess the Waymo Driver's performance – whether it's safely completing a 20-minute Waymo One rider-only trip across San Francisco or efficiently running an 11-hour goods-only Waymo Via trip from Phoenix to Dallas. Come to this talk to learn more!
Bio Luke Barrington‎ is a startup founder, A.I. PhD and, these days, a senior Product Manager in Google AI. He's spent his career inventing and building products to help understand our ever-changing planet. He will present his current mission to transform billions of real-world images into a "digital twin"; a realistic, editable 3D model of the earth.
https://twitter.com/lukeinusa
This talk is part of our DevFest Inspire event! #DevFestInspire

entry.title: Simona Stojanovic - DataStore - The Preferred Way To Store Data

media:group.media:title: Simona Stojanovic - DataStore - The Preferred Way To Store Data
media:group.media:description:
DataStore is a new and improved data storage solution, replacing SharedPreferences. Built on Kotlin coroutines and Flow, DataStore provides two different implementations: Proto DataStore, that stores typed objects (backed by protocol buffers) and Preferences DataStore, that stores key-value pairs. In this talk, you’ll see what DataStore offers over SharedPreferences, how to migrate easily and cover the basics of data storage - reading, writing, and error handling. Finally, we will see how to use it along with Kotlin coroutines and Flow to store data asynchronously, consistently, and transactionally.
Bio Simona Stojanovic works at Google as an Android Developer Relations Engineer, splitting her time between Architecture Components (DataStore) and Jetpack Compose. Before joining Google, Simona worked as an Android Dev in a variety of different industries - retail, transportation, banking, automotive & online dating. Aside from work, she loves to travel, read, organize stuff (😬), play video games and spend time with her 4 fluffy pets.
https://twitter.com/anomisSi

entry.title: Bogdan & Sorin - Fitbit Development SDK and how to build rich apps focused on wellbeing

media:group.media:title: Bogdan & Sorin - Fitbit Development SDK and how to build rich apps focused on wellbeing
media:group.media:description:
Want to learn how to build wearable health apps that can reach millions of users? In this session, we’ll be covering how the Fitbit Development SDK works and how developers can build rich apps focused on health data and wellbeing. We’ll deep dive with a case study of one of the health apps that we offer to our users.
Bogdan Purcareata Firmware engineer, TL for Fitbit Developer Platform SDK, interested and experienced in operating systems and development platforms. Motivated by software efficiency, robustness and elegance. Bodgan is located in Bucharest, Romania.
Sorin Ruse Sorin works as TLM (Technical Lead Manager) at Fitbit, now part of Google. He has been focused on the quality of the FDP platform that they built for the last 4 years.

entry.title: Amanda Cavallaro - How Firebase Helped Me Land My Dream Job

media:group.media:title: Amanda Cavallaro - How Firebase Helped Me Land My Dream Job
media:group.media:description:
Learn how the Firebase knowledge (in particular serverless functions) helped Amanda Cavallaro to speed up the prototyping and implementations of proof of concepts for talks and conferences and to ease the transition into her new role as a developer advocate in the cloud and communications sector.
Bio Amanda Cavallaro is an Italo-Brazilian developer advocate @ Vonage. She is a Google Developers Expert for the Firebase, Assistant and ML Cloud Conversational AI categories, who is passionate about cloud technologies, JavaScript, human-computer interactions and ambient computing and a love of learning. You can speak to her in Portuguese, English, Italian and a little Japanese.
https://twitter.com/amdcavallaro

entry.title: Maxim Salnikov - Native Web Apps: Are We There Yet?

media:group.media:title: Maxim Salnikov - Native Web Apps: Are We There Yet?
media:group.media:description:
There are so many discussions about web VS native apps. Will we get to the point where the Web becomes truly Native for the majority of the platforms? Progressive Web Apps, Project Fugu, WebAssembly & other technologies actively contribute to moving in this direction. In this session, we go through a list of details that make the integration of an application & operating system seamless, and map it to the APIs available for the web platform. With the knowledge of what's available today and what's coming soon, you are empowered to build truly Native Web Apps to deliver the best user experience!
Bio Maxim Salnikov is an Oslo-based cloud and tech community geek. He is a webdev maestro who builds apps since the end of the last century and shares his extensive web platform experience by speaking & training at developer events around the world. Daytime, Maxim is boosting cloud skills at the country scale by leading developer engagement in Microsoft Norway. In the evenings, you'll find him organizing the country's main web & mobile meetups, and two full-scale tech conferences.
https://twitter.com/webmaxru/
